Hi ken,

Thank you for your kind email, I didn't realize that they had Tic Tack
Toe example, anyway this will be great help to me as I want to build
topologies for a neural network Hex player for size 12 by 12. I have
read all your work regarding NEAT which I think it is really neat and
was really keen to use your idea for game of Hex as oppose to Go with
roving eye. But I will try using roving eye directly for 12 by 12 board
instead of starting with small board.

Thanks once more for your kind help and if you have any other
suggestions for my work, it will be highly appreciated specially coming
from a man like you.


Ramin


>>> kstanley@... 02/16/06 2:37 PM >>>
--- In neat@yahoogroups.com, "Ramin Lessani" <kcy42rl@...> wrote:
>
> Hi All,
> I want to buid an nnPlayer to play a board game. Could anyone suggest
> kindly how to do this as I am very new to ANJI and an detailed
> explanation in how to approach this would be highly appriciated.
> Ramin
>

Hi Ramin,

This isn't ANJI-specific, but have you read our paper on evolving an 
NN for Go?  It's at:

http://nn.cs.utexas.edu/keyword?stanley:gecco04

That might give you some general ideas.  Derek and Philip can probably 
help with specifics on getting started with ANJI, where they have a 
lot of experience with e.g. Tic Tac Toe.

ken
